Text:
I'll now give my investigation report on our recent
encounter with the templars in the Sacred Land of
Lindwurm.
*yawn* Tempuraaa... I wanna eat with Boss man again!
Please go ahead, Epsilon.

First, regarding the paladins known as templars,
believed to be part of the Church's armed faction...

We couldn't find any identifiable clues on the two
corpses killed in combat.

However, since they were carrying suicide pills,
I asked Beta to trace the contents and Eta to run
a composition analysis.

We've determined that it's a ritualistic poison
used by royals, nobles, and those in high-
ranking positions to bestow death for acts
of heresy recognized by the Church.

According to Eta, it's a potent drug that uses magic
as a trigger and is a valuable piece that takes time
to refine.

It's dark knowledge that has been passed down by the
Church to eradicate disgraceful impurities from this world.

The completely brainwashed templars use it on
themselves without hesitation.
These people smell to high heaven.
You mean they're smellier than you, kitty cat?
Can't beat the combined stench of doggie and boar.
What'd you say!

We're in a meeting, you two! If you want to fight,
go outside and take on the golem.
Nghh...
Heh...

...So Epsilon, any clues from the Cult members'
corpses?

Yes. This is the main topic of this meeting and
why I asked Zeta to attend.

We obtained intel from the clues left on the Cult
members' bodies, which has allowed us to infer
the location of their hideout.

The location...is the mountainous region,
north of Midgar.

That region is pretty vast. Were you able to discover
any clues to further narrow it down?

Indeed. Some of the Cult members wore amulets
made of rabbits' feet.

Zeta's research has revealed that these rabbits
belong to a rare species found only in specific
mountainous areas.

Turning the body parts of rare creatures into lucky
charms to carry aroundâ€”sounds like something that
would incur the wrath of the Church.
Is that why the tempura killed off the Cult members?
Who knows...

I can't say for certain. It's difficult to measure 
what an individual's fanatic faith can do to their
psyche.

I asked Eta to run a comparative analysis of the soil
in the mountainous area where the rabbits live,
using mud stains on two Cult members' clothing.
The two samples have an extremely high match rate.

In other words, it's likely the Cult members crafted
these amulets using what they had at hand instead
of items in circulation.

Exactly. It's worth looking into. They may have a
hidden facility there meant to avoid detection.

We can retrace their steps even if there's nothing
there, so it'll be worth it.
Either way, we kill all the Cult of Diablos bad guys!

You're both right. Now that we have a lead, we must
hunt them down at all costs.

Delta, Zeta, and I will immediately set out to
conduct a search and destroy.
Whaâ€”?! Me with this kitty cat?!

I'm supposed to go with this dumb dog?! You've got to
be kidding!
What'd you say?!
Tsk...!

Are you sure it's okay to put the two of them
together, Lady Alpha?

With their keen therianthropic instincts, they could
make a surprisingly effective duo in an emergency.

Just like you and Beta. Don't you think it's
worth a try?
Hey, kitty cat, quit ignoring me!
I can't even bother making the effort to ignore you.
Are you sure about this, Lady Alpha?!

An expedition to a remote area requires scouting
skills and a formidable force that can swiftly
eliminate any opponents who show up.

In that sense, this operation is the perfect
battlefield for Delta.

Well then, I have a scouting trip I need to prepare
for.

Graarf! Where do you think you're going? Get back
here! Awooo!!!
